subject: Does a new member start posting by emailing or can one use the Post function on the group pages?
msgSnippet: Dear Moderators, I have posted two messages using the Post function, and, since they haven t appeared as yet, and I know that new members first posts need
messageBody:
Dear Moderators,

I have posted two messages using the Post function,
and, since they haven't appeared as yet, and I know
that new members' first posts need moderator approval,
I don't know whether they are awaiting approval or
whether they were discarded as they were not sent by
email.

I don't have a copy of those posts, as I expected to
see them on the group page at some time.

If they don't appear there in a reasonable time, I
will re-write them and post by email.

Can I post from the group page? I've set my member
settings to No Email to avoid getting my email box
flooded by the many groups I'm on. So I read messages
on the group site, and would find it easier to post
directly from the Post function.

Yours sincerely,
Cossy

Dear Moderators,

I have posted two messages using the Post function,
and, since they haven't appeared as yet, and I know
that new members' first posts need moderator approval,
I don't know whether they are awaiting approval or
whether they were discarded as they were not sent by
email. 

I don't have a copy of those posts, as I expected to
see them on the group page at some time.

If they don't appear there in a reasonable time, I
will re-write them and post by email. 

Can I post from the group page? I've set my member
settings to No Email to avoid getting my email box
flooded by the many groups I'm on. So I read messages
on the group site, and would find it easier to post
directly from the Post function.

Yours sincerely,
Cossy
